data.question: What is the role of camphoric acid in the synthesis of homochiral coordination polymers?
data.answer: Camphoric acid acts as a chiral induction agent to achieve bulk absolute chiral coordination polymers with the desired helicity.

data.question: True or False: The presence of enantiopure camphoric acid leads to the formation of conglomerate metal organic frameworks.
data.answer: False

data.question: What method is used to confirm the absolute configurations of the synthesized coordination polymers?
data.answer: Solid-state circular dichroism (CD) spectroscopy is used to confirm the absolute configurations.

data.question: What is the effect of using (+)-camphoric acid versus (-)-camphoric acid in the crystallization process?
data.answer: (+)-Camphoric acid directs the formation of absolute negative homohelical CPs, whereas (-)-camphoric acid leads to the formation of absolute positive homohelical CPs.

data.question: True or False: The zinc and cobalt coordination polymers exhibit thermal stability up to approximately 280°C.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the significance of the Flack parameter in the context of this study?
data.answer: The Flack parameter is used to determine the absolute configuration of the chiral centers in the coordination polymers.

data.question: True or False: The luminescent properties of the coordination polymers are independent of the metal ion used.
data.answer: False

data.question: How does the absence of camphoric acid affect the crystallization of coordination polymers?
data.answer: In the absence of camphoric acid, the crystallization process yields a conglomerate of coordination polymers instead of absolute homochiral crystallization.

data.question: What is the role of the ligand L in the formation of the coordination polymers?
data.answer: The ligand L coordinates with the metal ions to form the two-dimensional network structure of the coordination polymers.

data.question: True or False: The coordination polymers synthesized in this study are all optically active.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the structural feature that contributes to the chirality of the coordination polymers?
data.answer: The self-assembly of homohelical motifs in the intrinsically chiral pseudo-Kagomé type 2D network contributes to the chirality.

data.question: True or False: The crystallization of coordination polymers in the presence of enantiopure camphoric acid always results in a single enantiomer.
data.answer: True

data.question: How does the use of enantiopure camphoric acid influence the helicity of the coordination polymers?
data.answer: The use of enantiopure camphoric acid influences the helicity by selectively inducing the formation of either right-handed (P) or left-handed (M) helical structures.

data.question: What analytical technique is used to determine the thermal stability of the coordination polymers?
data.answer: Thermogravimetric analysis (TGA) is used to determine the thermal stability.

data.question: True or False: The coordination polymers exhibit strong photoluminescence due to ligand-to-ligand energy transfer.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the significance of the observed mirror image relation in the CD spectra of the coordination polymers?
data.answer: The mirror image relation in the CD spectra signifies the presence of enantiomeric pairs of coordination polymers, indicating successful chiral induction.

data.question: True or False: The coordination polymers synthesized without camphoric acid show a dichroic signal in the CD spectra.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the role of the ligand L in the structural formation of the coordination polymers?
data.answer: The ligand L acts as a bridging ligand, connecting metal ions to form the helical motifs and two-dimensional network structure of the coordination polymers.

data.question: True or False: The coordination polymers' structures are determined using single crystal X-ray diffraction.
data.answer: True

data.question: How does the presence of camphoric acid affect the crystallization process of the coordination polymers?
data.answer: The presence of camphoric acid affects the crystallization process by directing the formation of either absolute positive or negative homohelical coordination polymers, depending on the enantiopurity of the camphoric acid used.
